page_summaries.1:
The Central Information Commission (CIC) is seeking bids for a comprehensive annual operation and maintenance contract for its building in New Delhi. 

**Key services included:**

* **Security:** Round-the-clock security service
* **Civil Works:** Maintenance of buildings, roads, hard standings, paths, security walls, sewer lines, plumbing, drainage, sanitary fixtures, etc.
* **Electrical Works:** Operation and maintenance of internal & external electrical systems, DG sets, specialized E&M equipment, transformers, HT electricity panels, LAN, Wi-Fi, EPBAX systems.
* **HVAC & Lifts:** Operation and CAMC of HVAC/VRV systems and lifts.
* **Water & Sanitation:** Operation and maintenance of RO & water coolers, STP plants, rainwater harvesting systems, and water supply systems.
* **Safety & Security:** Operation and maintenance of fire fighting systems (wet riser, sprinkler, fire alarm), CCTV cameras, and BMS.
* **IT & Communication:** Operation and maintenance of audio & video conferencing systems, networking equipment, and IT infrastructure.
* **Other Services:** Operation and maintenance of UPS systems, mechanized housekeeping, and horticulture.
* **Renewable Energy:** Operation and maintenance of solar power generation plant.
* **Public Address System:** Operation and maintenance of the public address system.

Interested parties should refer to the detailed tender document for specific requirements and submission guidelines.
page_summaries.2:
The Central Information Commission (CIC) is seeking tenders from eligible PSUs or government organizations for comprehensive annual operation and maintenance services at their headquarters building in New Delhi. 

**Key points:**

* **Scope of work:**  Includes civil works (building maintenance, roads, drainage, etc.), electrical works (power systems, lighting, etc.), HVAC, lifts, security systems, water supply, IT infrastructure, and more.
* **Tender type:** Two-bid system.
* **Eligibility:** PSUs set up by the Central or State Government, or other organizations notified by the Ministry of Urban Development for such purposes.
* **Objective:** Determine the lowest service charges for providing Project Management Consultancy (PMC) for the above-mentioned scope of works.
* **Tender document:** No. 4/1/2021/CIC /P&B dated 17.02.2022.


Interested parties should carefully review the tender document for detailed requirements and submission instructions.
page_summaries.3:
The Central Information Commission (CIC) is seeking bids for a contract worth Rs. 4.04 crore (including GST) to provide various services at their HQ building in New Delhi. 

**Key Points:**

* **Services:** Audio & Video Conferencing System, Networking (switches, active & passive components), UPS maintenance, mechanized housekeeping, and horticulture.
* **Contract Duration:** Two years from signing the MOU, with possible annual extensions for two more years at the same rates and conditions.
* **Bid Submission:** Online through the CPP Portal (e-precurement.gov.in) and the CIC website.
* **Eligibility:**  PSUs set up by the Central or State Government for civil or electrical works, or other notified organizations.
* **Tender Documents:** Available for download on the CPP Portal and CIC website.
* **Pre-Bid Clarification Meeting:** March 9, 2022, at 11:00 Hours.
* **Bid Submission Deadline:** April 1, 2022.
* **Financial Bid Opening:** To be announced later.


**Note:** No Earnest Money Deposit (EMD) is required. Bidders must submit a signed Bid-Securing Declaration Form instead.
page_summaries.4:
This tender document outlines eligibility requirements for bidders interested in a government office setup project. 

**Key Points:**

* **Experience:** Bidders must demonstrate experience in similar projects, such as turnkey government office setup or building operation & maintenance.  Specific criteria are provided based on the value of completed projects.
* **Financial Strength:**  Bidders must have a minimum average annual financial turnover of 30% of the estimated project cost over the last three years.  They must also have a positive net worth as of the previous financial year.
* **Documentation:** Bidders must carefully review all tender terms and conditions and submit all required documents. Information posted on the website is considered part of the tender document.


The document emphasizes the importance of bidders thoroughly understanding the requirements before submitting a tender.
page_summaries.5:
This tender document outlines the required components for bidders to submit a complete proposal. 

**Key Points:**

* **Tender Documents:**  A comprehensive set of documents is required, including the Notice Inviting e-Tender, Scope of Work, Bill of Quantities, Special Conditions of Contract, and various annexures.
* **Strict Adherence:** Bidders must strictly follow the terms, conditions, specifications, and standards outlined in the tender documents. Deviations are not permitted.
* **Complete Technical Bid:**  Bidders must submit all necessary technical information in the prescribed proforma. Incomplete or ambiguous information will lead to rejection.
* **Document Submission:** Bidders must submit copies of essential documents like GST registration, EPF & ESIC registration, and PAN No.
* **Eligibility:** Bidders will be assessed for eligibility, and tenders will be invalidated if ineligibility is discovered after opening.
* **Financial Turnover:** Bidders must submit an affidavit/certificate from a Chartered Accountant detailing their financial turnover for the past three years.
* **Query Submission:** Bidders can submit queries for clarification within 7 working days of the tender upload. CIC will only respond to essential queries related to bid submission.


**Overall:** The document emphasizes the need for a thorough and compliant bid submission, highlighting the importance of adhering to all requirements and providing complete information.
page_summaries.6:
This tender document outlines key points regarding bid submission and evaluation:

**Key Points:**

* **Queries:**  Must be submitted within 7 working days of the tender upload. Requests for technical bid opening extensions will not be granted.
* **Bid Documents:**  A comprehensive list is provided, including financial details, work experience, legal registrations, and an integrity pact. All documents must be clear and legible.
* **CIC Rights:** The Central Information Commission (CIC) reserves the right to reject any bid, cancel the tender, and award the work to one or multiple parties without explanation. The CIC is not obligated to accept the lowest bid.
* **Splitting Work:** The CIC can split the work among multiple contractors, and the contractor must accept the offered portion at the quoted rate.
* **Canvassing:**  Prohibited. Any canvassing will lead to bid rejection and forfeiture of earnest money.
* **Contact:**  Queries should be directed to Shri S.K. Rabbani, Deputy Secretary (GA), during office hours.


**Essentially, the document emphasizes strict adherence to deadlines, completeness of bid submissions, and the CIC's absolute discretion in the tender process.**
page_summaries.7:
This tender document outlines the requirements for the **operation and maintenance (O&M)** of the Central Information Commission (CIC) HQ Building in New Delhi. 

**Key Points:**

* **Scope:** Comprehensive O&M including civil works, electrical works, specialized equipment (HVAC, lifts, security systems, etc.), IT infrastructure, and landscaping.
* **Tender Type:** Open tender for PSUs or government organizations with experience in civil or electrical works.
* **Earnest Money Deposit:** Not required, but bidders must submit a Bid-Securing Declaration Form.
* **Contract Duration:** Two years with potential for annual extensions of two years each, subject to approval.
* **Payment Schedule:** Based on the DSR 2019 rates for Sanitary, Electrical, and Civil Works.
* **Performance Guarantee:** 3% of the contract value within 7 days of signing the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU).
* **General Conditions:** CPWD GCC 2020 for maintenance works, including any latest amendments.


Essentially, the CIC is seeking a qualified contractor to handle the day-to-day operations and maintenance of its building and facilities for a minimum of two years.
page_summaries.8:
The tender cost is calculated using the **DSR 2019 Schedule of Rates**.  

**Important:** The latest version of the DSR, including any amendments, will be the governing document for pricing.
page_summaries.9:
This document is a formal acceptance of tender conditions by a company bidding for a comprehensive annual operation and maintenance contract with the Central Information Commission. 

**Key points:**

* **Scope of work:**  The contract covers a wide range of services including security, civil works, electrical works, HVAC, lifts, pest control, fire safety, IT infrastructure, water supply, and landscaping.
* **Acceptance:** The company unconditionally accepts all tender conditions and documents in their entirety.
* **Eligibility:** The company confirms its eligibility to submit the tender and possesses all required documents.
* **Document review:** The company states that it has carefully reviewed all tender documents, including the Notice Inviting e-Tender, Guidelines, Scope of Work, Bill of Quantities, Special Conditions of Contract, and Memoranda. 


Essentially, this document signifies the company's serious intent to participate in the bidding process and its agreement to abide by all the terms and conditions set forth by the Central Information Commission.
page_summaries.10:
This page outlines key documents and conditions for bidders in a tender process. 

**Key Documents:**

* **Annexure-III:** Affidavit confirming the accuracy of submitted documents and information.
* **Annexure IV:** Bid Securing Declaration Form, replacing the traditional Earnest Money Deposit (EMD).
* **Annexure V:** Proforma for a Performance Bank Guarantee.
* **Annexure VI:** Price Bid Submission Form.
* **Addendum/Corrigendum:** Any updates or changes to the original tender document, signed by an authorized person.

**Key Conditions:**

* **Acceptance:** Bidders agree to fully comply with all terms and conditions outlined in the tender documents.
* **Consequences of Non-Compliance:** Failure to meet obligations (commence work, sign agreement, submit performance guarantee) will result in forfeiture of the bid securing declaration and potential cancellation of the Letter of Award.


Essentially, this page emphasizes the seriousness of the bidding process and the consequences of non-compliance.
page_summaries.11:
This affidavit, required for a tender bid, confirms the following key points:

* **Bidder Identity:** The signatory is the proprietor or authorized representative of the company submitting the bid.
* **Document Authenticity:** All information, documents, and experience certificates submitted are true and accurate. The bidder consents to CIC verifying them with issuing authorities.
* **Consequences of False Information:** If any information is found false, the CIC can disqualify, reject, or terminate the bid/contract and forfeit all dues.
* **Bank Guarantee Verification:** The CIC can verify any bank guarantees submitted, including performance guarantees, with the issuing bank.
* **Bank Guarantee Authenticity:** The bidder confirms the genuineness of the bank guarantee and understands that any falsity will lead to bid rejection, pre-qualification cancellation, and a three-year ban from future tenders.
* **Blacklisting Status:** The bidder confirms that their firm is not blacklisted or banned from tendering by the government or PSUs. Any falsity will result in bid disqualification.
* **Authorized Representative:** The signatory is an authorized representative of the company, and the company is responsible for their actions related to the tender. 


Essentially, this affidavit ensures transparency and accountability in the bidding process.
page_summaries.12:
This page is a notarized affidavit confirmation. 

**Key Points:**

* **Confirmation of Truthfulness:** The Proprietor/Authorized signatory of a company (name redacted) confirms that the contents of a previous affidavit are accurate and complete.
* **No Concealment or Falsehood:** They state that nothing has been hidden or falsified in the affidavit.
* **Notarization:** The document is notarized, meaning it has been verified by a notary public, adding legal weight to the confirmation. 


Let me know if you need any further clarification.
page_summaries.13:
This document is a Bid-Securing Declaration, a substitute for a traditional bid security deposit. 

**Key Points:**

* **Purpose:**  Guarantees the bidder's commitment to the bidding process and their ability to fulfill contract obligations if awarded.
* **Consequences of Breach:** The bidder risks disqualification from future contracts with the Central Information Commission for three years if they:
    * Withdraw, modify, or amend their bid during the validity period.
    * Refuse to sign the contract or provide the required Performance Bank Guarantee after being notified of their successful bid.
* **Validity:** The declaration is valid until the earlier of:
    * Notification of the successful bidder.
    * Thirty days after the bid's expiration date.


Essentially, this declaration serves as a legal commitment from the bidder, ensuring they will honor their bid and fulfill contractual obligations if selected.
page_summaries.14:
This document is a Performance Bank Guarantee issued by a bank to the Central Information Commission (CIC). 

**Key Points:**

* **Purpose:** To guarantee the contractor's (M/s. ...) fulfillment of a contract awarded by CIC.
* **Amount:** The guarantee is for 3% of the total contract value (Rs....).
* **Bank's Obligation:** The bank unconditionally and irrevocably promises to pay CIC any amount due from the contractor if they breach the contract terms.
* **Validity:** The guarantee remains valid for the contract's duration.
* **CIC's Rights:** CIC has the right to modify the contract terms, extend deadlines, or postpone actions against the contractor without affecting the bank's liability.
* **Bank's Liability:** The bank's maximum liability is limited to the guaranteed amount (Rs..............).


Essentially, this document ensures CIC is protected financially if the contractor fails to meet their contractual obligations.
page_summaries.15:
This bank guarantee document outlines the bank's commitment to pay the CIC (presumably a client or organization) if the supplier/contractor fails to fulfill their obligations. 

Here are the key points:

* **Additional Security:** This guarantee is in addition to any other security the CIC might have. The bank is fully liable regardless of other guarantees in place.
* **Unconditional Enforcement:** The CIC can directly enforce this guarantee without first pursuing the supplier/contractor.
* **Indemnity Against Liquidation:** The guarantee remains valid even if the supplier/contractor goes bankrupt or undergoes restructuring.
* **Dispute Resolution:** Disputes between the supplier/contractor and CIC won't affect the bank's obligation to pay.
* **Non-Revocation:** The bank cannot revoke the guarantee without the CIC's written consent.

**Validity:** The guarantee is valid for 30 months from the date of the work order. 


Essentially, this document ensures the CIC is protected financially if the supplier/contractor defaults on their contract.
page_summaries.16:
This document is a Price Bid Submission Form for a tender issued by the Central Information Commission (CIC) for the operation and maintenance (O&M) services of their building in New Delhi. 

**Key Points:**

* **Scope of Work:** The tender covers a wide range of services, including daily operations, security, repairs, maintenance of civil, electrical, mechanical, and IT infrastructure, landscaping, and specialized systems like HVAC, lifts, fire fighting, and solar power generation.
* **Bid Submission:** The form requires bidders to submit their proposed service charges as a percentage for the entire scope of work.
* **Tender Document:** Bidders confirm receipt and understanding of the tender document, including any amendments or corrigendums.


Essentially, this form is used by potential service providers to formally offer their pricing for the comprehensive maintenance and operation of the CIC building.
page_summaries.17:
This page outlines the bidder's agreement to the tender process:

* **Bid Validity:** The bid remains valid for 150 days (or longer if agreed upon). Acceptance can occur anytime within this period.
* **Binding Contract:** The bid, along with the buyer's written acceptance, forms a binding contract until a formal agreement is signed.
* **Compliance:** The bidder agrees to all Central Information Commission terms and conditions, including those in Para 4 of the "Guidelines for Submission of Tender."
* **Lowest Bid Not Guaranteed:** The buyer is not obligated to accept the lowest bid.
* **Good Standing:** The bidder confirms they are not de-registered, banned, or blacklisted by any government authority.
* **Acceptance of Terms:** The bidder fully agrees to all terms and conditions in the bidding document, including any amendments or corrections. 


The page concludes with the bidder's signature, confirming their authorization to submit the bid on behalf of their organization.
page_summaries.18:
This tender document outlines the submission process and key criteria for awarding a contract for comprehensive annual operation and maintenance of the CIC Building. 

**Key Points:**

* **Bid Submission:** Bids must include a bid security declaration form and be submitted online through the CPP Portal by March 29, 2022, at 5:00 PM. Technical and Financial bids must be submitted separately in sealed envelopes.
* **Bid Opening:** Technical bids will be opened on March 30, 2022, at 11:00 AM. Financial bids of technically qualified bidders will be opened at a later date.
* **Award Criteria:** The agency quoting the lowest service charges will be awarded the contract. In case of a tie, the agency with the highest average turnover over the last three years will be preferred.
* **Payment Terms:** Payment will be made after completion of work and submission of a monthly invoice. Payment will be made through e-payment/NEFT/RTGS.


**Important:** Bids without the bid security declaration form will be rejected.
page_summaries.19:
This contract document outlines key terms and conditions for a two-year (extendable) service agreement for housekeeping, horticulture, and other maintenance services at the Central Information Commission (CIC). 

**Here are the key points:**

* **Contract Formation:** The contract comprises the tender, acceptance, formal agreement, and these special conditions. In case of conflict, the SCC takes precedence.
* **Contract Duration:** The initial contract is for two years, renewable annually for another two years at the CIC's discretion based on performance.
* **Site Visit:** The tenderer must thoroughly inspect the site and understand the working conditions, including existing infrastructure and potential challenges. No claims for ignorance will be accepted.
* **Feedback Mechanism:** The agency must collect monthly feedback forms from allottees and address any issues promptly.
* **Workforce Management:** The agency is responsible for deploying the specified number of workers. Extra deployment won't be paid for, while shortfalls will result in deductions from bills.
* **Minimum Wages:** The agency must pay workers the applicable minimum wage as per Central Government notifications. Any changes in minimum wages during the contract period will be reimbursed or deducted from bills accordingly.


The document emphasizes the importance of thorough site assessment, timely feedback response, and adherence to minimum wage regulations.
page_summaries.20:
This tender document outlines key requirements and penalties for a contractor responsible for building maintenance. 

**Key Points:**

* **Compliance is crucial:**  Penalties will be imposed for failing to meet any conditions.
* **Biometric Attendance:** The contractor must use biometric attendance machines and provide monthly attendance records along with staff details.
* **Online Complaint System:** A dedicated online system for managing complaints is mandatory, with daily submissions of checklists and logbooks.
* **Standard Operating Procedures (SOP):**  A detailed SOP for building operation and maintenance must be submitted within 15 days of contract award. Failure to do so will halt payment processing.
* **Defect Response Time:**  Minor breakdowns must be fixed within 4 hours, major defects within 48 hours.  Liquidated damages (up to 5% of contract value) apply for delays.
* **Statutory Compliance:** The contractor is responsible for adhering to various labor laws, including EPF, ESIC, bonus, weekly off, and GST. Proof of compliance is required, and non-compliance will result in deductions from payments. 


Essentially, the document emphasizes the importance of timely service delivery, strict adherence to regulations, and transparent reporting.
page_summaries.21:
This tender document outlines key requirements for a security and maintenance contract at the Central Information Commission Building in New Delhi. 

**Key Points:**

* **Statutory Compliance:** The tenderer is fully responsible for meeting all applicable statutory requirements, including minimum wage regulations.
* **Minimum Wages:**  The document provides current minimum wage rates for various security and labor categories as per Central Government notification.
* **Uniforms & Equipment:** The tenderer must provide uniforms, shoes, sweaters, and raincoats to all workers at their own expense.
* **Work Packages:** The project is divided into two packages:
    * **Package A:** Comprehensive operation and maintenance of various building systems, including electrical, fire safety, security, and landscaping.
    * **Package B:**  Comprehensive Annual Maintenance Contract (CAMC) for four lifts at the building.


The tenderer must ensure compliance with all requirements and is solely responsible for any consequences arising from non-compliance.
page_summaries.22:
This tender document outlines the scope of work for the operation and comprehensive maintenance of the Central Information Commission Building in New Delhi. 

**Key Points:**

* **Scope:** The contract covers a wide range of services including civil, electrical, fire fighting, water supply, DG sets, lifts, VRV systems, horticulture, housekeeping, pest control, security, IT & AV services, and BMS.
* **Building Details:** The building comprises basements (B1+B2), ground floor, and 4 floors, totaling 9772 sq m of built-up area and 4653 sq m of plot area.
* **Facility Manager:** The successful bidder must deploy a qualified Facility Manager (Graduate in Electrical/Civil Engineering with 3+ years experience) at the site at no extra cost. A penalty of Rs. 2000 per day will be imposed for the FM's absence.
* **Standards:** Work must adhere to CPWD specifications and safety procedures outlined in relevant CPWD guidelines for each service area. 


Essentially, the tender seeks a comprehensive maintenance provider for a large building complex with a wide range of systems and services.
page_summaries.23:
This tender document outlines key requirements for service providers, focusing on:

* **Inclusive Pricing:** Quoted rates must cover all labor costs (including relievers), materials, uniforms, bonuses, and taxes.
* **Safety Responsibility:** The tenderer is solely responsible for worker safety and any resulting accidents or compensation claims.
* **Waste Management:** All waste generated during work must be collected, transported, and disposed of outside the campus by the tenderer at their own expense.
* **Site Restrictions:** No temporary structures or tents are allowed on the site or government land.
* **Duty Chart:** A detailed fortnightly/monthly duty chart must be submitted seven days in advance.
* **Equipment Damage:** The tenderer is liable for any damage caused by their staff's negligence.
* **Preventive Maintenance:** Regular preventive maintenance is required with dedicated teams and is included in the quoted rates.
* **Staff Conduct:** The tenderer must immediately replace staff exhibiting misconduct.
* **Site Visit:**  Tenderers are strongly advised to visit the site before quoting to assess the scope of work. 


Essentially, the document emphasizes the tenderer's full responsibility for all aspects of the work, from labor and materials to safety, waste management, and staff conduct.
page_summaries.24:
This tender document outlines key requirements for staff and payment terms for the contractor. 

**Staff:**

* **Categorization:** Staff are categorized as unskilled (sweepers, beldars, helpers), skilled (plumbers, carpenters, electricians), and highly skilled (IT engineers, supervisors). They must wear distinct uniforms.
* **Identification:** All personnel must wear approved uniforms with name badges and carry identity cards signed by the tenderer.

**Liability:**

* The tenderer is fully responsible for any unlawful acts committed by their personnel during work.
* The tenderer is liable for any theft or loss of departmental property due to negligence of their staff.

**Communication:**

* The tenderer must provide a 24/7 communication system (mobile phone or landline) at a designated location for lodging complaints and receiving instructions.

**Worker Payment and Safety:**

* **Payment:** Salaries must be paid by the 7th of each month via cheque or electronic transfer (IMPS/NEFT/RTGS). A certificate confirming payment is required. Penalties apply for late or missed payments.
* **Compensation:** The tenderer is responsible for worker compensation and must inform the Commission.
* **Safety:** The tenderer must ensure worker safety and obtain Workman Compensation Act insurance within 10 days of signing the MOU. The Commission is not liable for accidents.

**Payment Terms for Contractor:**

* Payment is based on the method detailed in the individual sub-head's additional terms and conditions.
* Bills must be submitted electronically and in triplicate.
page_summaries.25:
This tender document outlines key requirements for a maintenance service provider. 

**Payments:**

* Monthly payments are made after the provider submits proof of worker wages, EPF, and ESIC deposits.

**Inventory:**

* The provider takes over existing inventory and reports any discrepancies.
* Upon completion, the provider hands over the updated inventory.
* Any damage or shortfall is the provider's responsibility to rectify.

**Consumables:**

* The provider is responsible for all consumables and tools required for maintenance.
* A detailed stock register of purchased and consumed materials must be maintained.
* Unserviceable materials received during repairs belong to the Commission.

**Equipment:**

* The provider must provide all tools, tackles, and machinery needed for maintenance work. No additional payment will be made for this.


Essentially, the provider is responsible for all aspects of maintenance, including labor, materials, tools, and equipment, with payment tied to proof of work completion and adherence to legal requirements.
page_summaries.26:
This tender document outlines the requirements for civil maintenance services at a building. 

**Key points:**

* **Scope of work:**  Comprehensive maintenance including minor repairs, earthwork, carpentry, painting, plumbing, drainage, sewage system upkeep, and cleaning of water tanks and lines.
* **Frequency:**  Cleaning of water tanks, rain water lines, and sewerage lines every six months.
* **Staffing:**  The contractor must deploy qualified and experienced staff, including a plumber, carpenter, and mason, for general shifts on weekdays (excluding Sundays and national holidays).
* **Qualifications:**  The contractor must submit a list of workers with their qualifications and addresses before starting work.
* **Pricing:**  All maintenance tasks, including cleaning, are included in the quoted rates.


The document emphasizes the need for thorough and regular maintenance to ensure the building's functionality and safety.
page_summaries.27:
This tender document outlines requirements for a one-year contract providing plumbing, carpentry, and masonry services. 

**Key Points:**

* **Service:** General shift work only.
* **Record Keeping:** The contractor must maintain a complaint register and worker's diary, ensuring prompt complaint resolution and reporting any unresolved issues to the Site In Charge.
* **Completion and Defects:** Upon contract end, the contractor must hand over fully functional installations. Any defects must be rectified to the Commission's satisfaction, or the work will be done at the contractor's expense.
* **Attendance:** Missing staff will be marked absent, and the contractor will be financially penalized. The contractor is responsible for arranging replacements for leave or reliever duty, or face penalties. 


The document emphasizes accountability, timely service, and the contractor's responsibility for maintaining a fully functional installation.
page_summaries.28:
This tender document outlines the requirements for 24/7 electrical maintenance services for multiple buildings. 

**Key Points:**

* **Scope:** Includes daily complaint response for internal electrical installations, compound lights, main boards, and solar power generation systems.  Preventive maintenance tasks like DB checks, fan cleaning, insulation and earth tests are also required.
* **Materials:** The contractor must provide all necessary electrical and plumbing consumables (bulbs, wires, valves, etc.) at no extra cost.
* **Tools & Equipment:** The contractor is responsible for providing all tools, tackles, and machinery needed for the work.
* **Staffing:**  Three qualified electricians (one per shift) and one helper are required daily, including Sundays and holidays.  The contractor must submit worker details (qualifications, addresses) before starting work.


Essentially, the tender seeks a reliable contractor to handle all aspects of electrical maintenance, from immediate repairs to scheduled preventative tasks, using their own resources and qualified personnel.
page_summaries.29:
This tender document outlines staffing requirements, complaint handling, equipment handover, defect rectification, and testing procedures for electrical work. 

**Key Points:**

* **Staffing:** Requires a Wireman/Electrician with ITI certificate/license and 3+ years experience, and a Khallasi/Helper with 6+ months experience.
* **Complaints:**  Must be attended promptly. Unresolved complaints must be reported to the Site In Charge daily.
* **Equipment Handover:** "As is where is" basis. Contractor responsible for rectifying defects after contract expiry.
* **Testing:**  Regular DB, fan, and earth tests are mandatory. Insulation tests during monsoon, earth continuity and resistance tests during summer.  
* **Staff Absences:**  Contractor responsible for arranging replacements. Penalty for missing staff will be deducted from bills. 


The document emphasizes the contractor's responsibility for quality workmanship, timely complaint resolution, and adherence to testing protocols.
page_summaries.30:
This tender document outlines the requirements for a contractor to provide ongoing operation and maintenance services for firefighting and water supply pumps, fire alarm systems, and PA systems. 

**Key points:**

* **24/7 Coverage:** The contractor must provide continuous operation and maintenance services.
* **Scheduled Maintenance:**  Daily, weekly, and six-monthly checks are required, with internal cleaning of equipment during weekly testing.
* **Fire Drills:** Monthly fire drills must be conducted, involving building caretakers and recording the details.
* **System Health Checks:** Weekly testing of hydrants and pumps is mandatory, with records maintained and site-in-charge involvement.
* **Fire Alarm & PA System Maintenance:** Routine inspection, testing, and record-keeping for fire alarms, smoke detectors, amplifiers, speakers, and microphones are required.
* **Fire Extinguisher Refilling:** Annual refilling of fire extinguishers is required, plus refilling after each use. 


The contractor must also take over and return the site inventory in working condition.
page_summaries.31:
This tender document outlines the responsibilities of the contractor for fire safety and water supply system maintenance at a facility. 

**Key Points:**

* **Contractor Responsibilities:**
    *  Fire extinguisher handling (loading, unloading, transportation, reinstallation) at the Commission's discretion.
    *  Providing all consumables for servicing water pumps, fire fighting installations, etc.
    *  Maintaining the Control Room 24/7.
    *  Daily inspection and maintenance of yard hydrants, internal hydrants, and sprinkler systems.
    *  Arranging diesel for engine pumps (reimbursement based on actual consumption).
    *  Rectifying any malfunctions in fire fighting equipment at their own cost.
    *  Deploying qualified staff for fire fighting and water pump operation.

* **Staffing Requirements:**
    *  3 Fire Operators (round-the-clock coverage).
    *  1 Pump Operator (single shift, all days).
    *  Minimum 3 years experience for Fire Operators, certified "Fire Fighting System" course preferred.

* **Penalties:**
    *  Rs. 1600 per day per shift for each missing Fire Operator or Pump Operator.


The contractor is responsible for all aspects of fire safety and water supply system maintenance, including staff deployment and rectification of any issues at their own expense.
page_summaries.32:
This document outlines maintenance tasks for various fire fighting equipment. 

**Key Points:**

* **Siamese Connections:** Testing, cleaning, and inspecting the cabinet and its components.
* **Yard Hydrants:**  Testing, greasing, cleaning, and inspecting the hydrant valve and surrounding components.
* **Sprinkler System Alarm Bell:** Testing the bell, its connections, and addressing any leaks.
* **Sprinkler Sluice Valve:** Cleaning, operating, and replacing packing as needed.
* **Internal Hydrants:** Polishing, greasing, operating, and inspecting valves.
* **Hose Reel:** Unrolling, re-rolling, operating, and cleaning the hose reel and its components.
* **Branch Pipe & Nozzle:** Removing, cleaning, and re-installing the branch pipe and nozzle.
* **Canvass Hoses:** Removing, drying, dusting, polishing, and re-rolling the hoses.
* **Cabinet and Shaft:** Cleaning the interior and exterior of the cabinet and shaft, including replacing broken glass.


Essentially, the document details a comprehensive maintenance schedule for ensuring the functionality and safety of fire fighting equipment.
page_summaries.33:
This section of the tender document outlines maintenance tasks for various fire protection system components:

* **Air Vessel:** Cleaning, draining, pressure gauge replacement, and leak repair.
* **Cut-off Valves:** Chamber cleaning, gland packing replacement, lubrication, and tightness checks.
* **Sprinklers:** Cleaning, polishing, and pressure testing.
* **Non-return Valves:** Leakage checks and gasket replacement.
* **Drain Valves:** Polishing, full operation checks, and leakage checks. 


Essentially, the document specifies a comprehensive inspection and maintenance program for key fire suppression system components.
page_summaries.34:
This appendix outlines the **periodic testing and maintenance schedule** for a fire suppression system. 

**Key points:**

* **Frequency:** Tasks range from daily checks (e.g., water tank level, engine running) to annual inspections (e.g., flow test on water tanks, hose reel operation).
* **Components:** The schedule covers various system components: water tanks, engine, motor, piping, valves, control system, hose reel, fire brigade connections, and instantaneous water flow devices.

final_summary:
## Central Information Commission (CIC) Building Operation & Maintenance Tender Overview

**Overall Summary:**

The Central Information Commission (CIC) seeks a qualified contractor to provide comprehensive operation and maintenance (O&M) services for its building in New Delhi. This includes a wide range of services covering building systems, security, landscaping, and IT infrastructure. The tender emphasizes strict adherence to statutory requirements, performance standards, and transparent reporting.

**Project Overview:**

The CIC requires a reliable and experienced contractor to manage the ongoing operation and maintenance of its building and equipment. This encompasses:

* **Building Systems:**  Civil, electrical, fire fighting, water supply, DG sets, lifts, VRV systems, and horticulture.
* **Housekeeping & Security:**  Housekeeping services, pest control, 24/7 security services, and access control.
* **IT & AV Services:**  IT infrastructure maintenance, AV system upkeep, BMS management, and internet services.

**Technical Specifications:**

* **Facility Manager:** A qualified (Graduate in Electrical/Civil Engineering with 3+ years experience) Facility Manager must be deployed on-site at no extra cost.
* **Staffing:** Categorized workforce (unskilled, skilled, highly skilled) with distinct uniforms and identification badges. 
* **Safety:** Contractor is solely responsible for worker safety and any resulting accidents or compensation claims.
* **Waste Management:** Contractor is responsible for waste collection, transportation, and disposal outside the campus.
* **Equipment:** Contractor provides all tools, tackles, and machinery required for the work.
* **Preventive Maintenance:** Regular preventive maintenance with dedicated teams is mandatory and included in quoted rates.
* **Site Restrictions:** No temporary structures or tents allowed on the site or government land.
* **Communication:** 24/7 communication system (mobile phone or landline) for lodging complaints and receiving instructions.
* **Worker Payment and Safety:** Salaries paid by the 7th of each month via cheque or electronic transfer. Contractor must obtain Workman Compensation Act insurance within 10 days of signing the MOU.

**Financial Breakdown:**

* **Pricing:** Inclusive of all labor costs (including relievers), materials, uniforms, bonuses, and taxes.
* **Payment Terms:** Based on individual sub-head's additional terms and conditions. Bills submitted electronically and in triplicate.

**Timeline & Deadlines:**

* **Bid Submission Deadline:** March 29, 2022, 5:00 PM (Online through CPP Portal)
* **Bid Opening:** March 30, 2022, at 11:00 AM
* **Bid Validity:** 150 days (or longer if agreed upon)
* **Contract Duration:** 2 years (renewable annually for 2 more years)

**Compliance Requirements:**

* **Bid Security Declaration Form:** Mandatory for bid submission.
* **Compliance with CIC Terms and Conditions:** Bidder must confirm full compliance.
* **Good Standing:** Bidder must be in good standing with no de-registration, bans, or blacklisting by any government authority.
* **Statutory Compliance:** Adherence to all labor laws (EPF, ESIC, bonus, weekly off, GST) with proof of compliance.
* **Penalties:** Imposed for non-compliance with any conditions.
